text: Another deeply frustrating day for business. Renegotiation is a throw-of-the-dice, it must succeed or fail fast. Rejecting no deal is welcome but doesn‚Äôt get a deal. Until MPs can agree a solution, the threat of no deal will continue to drain money from the UK.

text: No deal in March 2019 must be off the table. Both sides need to step back from their entrenched positions. They must focus on 3 key principles: a deal that commands consensus in Parliament, can be negotiated with the EU & protects the livelihoods of communities across the UK.

text: This is another bleak day for business. Government‚Äôs move to consult more widely is welcome, as is the commitment to scrap the settled status charge for EU citizens, but the fundamentals have not changed. Parliament remains in deadlock while the slope to a cliff edge steepens.

text: Every business will tonight feel no deal is hurtling closer. A new plan is needed immediately. Now is the time for our politicians to make history as leaders. All MPs need to reflect on the need for compromise and to act at speed to protect the UK's economy.
